LanguageData.EmpathyChangesTooltip: Turn this off to restore colonists' reactions to bad things happening to other people to normal. This will increase difficulty; Bleeding Heart pawns will be unaffected. Restart the game after disabling this.
LanguageData.SexualityChangesTooltip: Turn this off to disable Kinsey scaling of pawns and re-enable the Gay trait. Do NOT change this during play, and restart the game after toggling this.
LanguageData.KinseyModeTooltip: This setting determines what formula is used to set the Kinsey rating of generated pawns. Weights do not have to sum to 100.
LanguageData.KWTooltip: The relative weight that a pawn will generate with a Kinsey rating of {0}. Weights do not have to sum to 100.
LanguageData.IndividualityTooltip: Turn this off to disable the negative thought your colonists will get if they are wearing perfectly matching outfits with other colonists. This thought adds extra difficulty, so it's optional, but recommended. Requires restart.
LanguageData.ElectionsTooltip: Turn this off to prevent your colonists from having yearly elections. It will not stop an election in progress, and any existing mayor will be reverted to a normal colonist. This will not affect compatibility with other mods. Requires restart for full effect.
LanguageData.DurationTooltip: Set how long people will remember conversations for. The default is 60 days, i.e. one year. The minimum is 15 day, one quadrum, and the maximum is 180 days, three years. Setting it lower will make colonists' interactions with each other more ephemeral, and setting it higher will make them more lasting. Requires restart.
LanguageData.SendDateLettersTooltip: Turn this off to disable receiving letters when your colonists plan a date together.
LanguageData.ImprisonedTooltip: This sets the negative opinion penalty (Faction imprison me) for recruited prisoners. Requires restart.
LanguageData.RomanceMultiplierTooltip: Romance chance will be multiplied by this value. Setting to 0 should eliminate new romances entirely.
LanguageData.RomanceChanceThresholdTooltip: Minimum opinion one colonist must have of another in order to be romanced.
LanguageData.MayorAgeTooltip: Minimum age required for someone to be able to become a mayor.
LanguageData.MayorVisitMtbHoursTooltip: This controls the expected time in hours between constituents meeting with their mayor. Lower values will increase the frequency of visits.
LanguageData.MentalBreakAnxietyChanceTooltip: This sets the mean chance a pawn will develop anxiety after having a major mental break. For minor breaks, the chance is halved and for extreme breaks the chance is doubled. The chance will also depend on colonist's psyche. Note that you might still see it as random disease due to aging.
LanguageData.TraitOpinionMultiplierTooltip: Scale the opinion changes from the following traits: Pretty, Ugly, Disfigured, Annoying voice, Creepy breathing, Body modder appreciation, and Body purist disgust. Set to zero to completely disable. Requires restart.
LanguageData.PersonalityExtremenessTooltip: Set the degree to which personalities will be boosted to match Big Five archetypes.
LanguageData.IdeoPsycheMultiplierTooltip: This controls how strongly personality and ideology interact with each other. Set to zero to disable entirely.
LanguageData.DisplayOptionsTooltip: Change the default display option for the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.UseColorsTooltip: Colorize traits displayed in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.ListAlphabeticalTooltip: List the traits alphabetically in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.UseAntonymsTooltip: Use trait antonyms in the Psyche tab.
LanguageData.EnablePsycheTooltip: Turn this off to deactivate personality. This is recommended for species not capable of having a human-like personality such as zombies or simple robots. Note that deep conversations and romance will be disabled for this species.
LanguageData.EnableAgeGapTooltip: Turn this off to deactivate the romantic age gap preference for pawns considering to romance this species. This is recommended for android-like and elf-like species that do not experience aging and remain equally attractive once they reach adulthood.
LanguageData.MinRomanceAgeTooltip: The minimum {0_RomanceBehavior} age for this species. When positive, the effective age in {0_RomanceBehavior}-related formulas is scaled by this number relative to {1_MinAge}. Setting to 0 allows {0_RomanceBehavior} at any age and effectively disables the age gap. This is recommended for species with no childhood phase such as sentient androids. Any negative number disables {0_RomanceBehavior} for this species.
